description:
chromeos: Implement PowerSaveBlocker.

This adds a Chrome OS implementation of PowerSaveBlocker to
prevent e.g. the system from suspending during a download or
the screen from dimming while web video is being played.

BUG=114128


Committed: http://src.chromium.org/viewvc/chrome?view=rev&revision=158625

messages.text:
Mike, mind taking a look at this?

Antoine, mind rubber-stamping for content/?

+jam 
I would have imagined that this sort of feature would belong more in chrome than in content, but apparently it's there on other platforms. John, you have thoughts about adding chromeos/ here?
Other than that, the code looks fine.

LGTM

IIRC, this code originally lived in chrome, and it got moved to content. :)

I'm a little wary of adding a new dependency from content, especially on chromeos. From what I understand, in the future chromeos will consume content as features like panels move from src/chrome to src/chromeos. This will mean there's a circular dependency.

So I'm leaning towards doing this through the Content API (i.e. the current way of getting "out" of content) instead of adding a dependency on chromeos.

i'm now not as against including src/chromeos as before, since Ben convinced me it's just like including system headers on other platforms. can you make the DEPS more specific, i.e. just edit content/browser/DEPS, and for now only allow "chromeos/power"?
